abstract: <jats:p>The sawfly genus<jats:italic>Heterarthrus</jats:italic>is naturally distributed in the Palaearctic, with a single described Oriental species. Their larvae mine in the leaves of trees and shrubs of Salicaceae, Betulaceae, and Sapindaceae (<jats:italic>Acer</jats:italic>). We here recognise twelve West Palaearctic species as valid, with the status of two additional nominal species group taxa in need of further study:<jats:italic>fruticicolum</jats:italic>Ermolenko, and<jats:italic>smithi</jats:italic>Ermolenko. A key to adults of the species occurring in the West Palaearctic is presented. Two new species are described:<jats:italic>Heterarthus vikbergi</jats:italic>Liston, Mutanen &amp; Viitasaari,<jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>from females and males reared from leaf-mines in<jats:italic>Populus balsamifera</jats:italic>collected in eastern Finland, and<jats:italic>Heterarthrus fiora</jats:italic>Liston,<jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>from females reared from<jats:italic>Acer pseudoplatanus</jats:italic>. The latter is a widespread European species, previously misidentified as<jats:italic>Heterarthrus aceris</jats:italic>(Kaltenbach, 1856). New junior subjective synonyms are<jats:italic>Phyllotoma aceris</jats:italic>Kaltenbach, 1856 of<jats:italic>Heterarthrus leucomela</jats:italic>(Klug, 1818),<jats:italic>H. aihinoensis</jats:italic>Haris, 2006 of<jats:italic>H. kamtchaticus</jats:italic>(Malaise, 1931) sp. rev., and<jats:italic>H. imbrosensis</jats:italic>Schedl, 1981 of<jats:italic>H. wuestneii</jats:italic>(Konow, 1905). Lectotypes are designated for<jats:italic>Phyllotoma flavicollis</jats:italic>Gussakovskij, 1947,<jats:italic>P. kamtchatica</jats:italic>Malaise, 1931, and<jats:italic>Tenthredo ochropoda</jats:italic>Klug, 1818.</jats:p>
title: On the taxonomy of Heterarthrus (Hymenoptera, Tenthredinidae), with a review of the West Palaearctic species
